text: The 2019 Florida A&M; Rattlers football team represented Florida A&M; University in the 2019 NCAA Division I FCS football season. The Rattlers were led by second-year head coach Willie Simmons. They played their home games at Bragg Memorial Stadium and were a member of the Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference (MEAC). Florida A&M; finished the year 9–2, 7–1 in MEAC play to finish with the best overall record in the MEAC and across all HBCU schools. However, in May 2019, Florida A&M; was banned from 2019 postseason play, so could not compete in the Celebration Bowl or for a MEAC championship. ==Previous season== The Rattlers finished the 2018 season 6–5, 5–2 in MEAC play to finish in a tie for second place. ==Preseason== ===MEAC poll=== In the MEAC preseason poll released on July 26, 2019, the Rattlers were predicted to finish in third place. {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1 || North Carolina A&T; || 304 (12) |- align="center" | 2 || Bethune–Cookman || 237 (1) |- align="center" | 3 || Florida A&M; || 204 (2) |- align="center" | 4 || Howard || 166 |- align="center" | 5 || North Carolina Central || 161 (1) |- align="center" | 6 || South Carolina State || 152 |- align="center" | 7 || Norfolk State || 119 (1) |- align="center" | 8 || Morgan State || 87 (1) |- align="center" | 9 || Delaware State || 46 |} ===Preseason All–MEAC teams=== The Rattlers had eleven players selected to the preseason all-MEAC teams.
